  • ### Resumen de la tabla: La tabla presenta datos sobre "salud y seguridad ocupacional" en los años 2024 y 2023, desglosados por género (Hombres, Mujeres) y Totales. Las etiquetas de las columnas son: "Número de accidentes ocupacionales fatales o enfermedades relacionadas con el trabajo", "Enfermedades relacionadas con el trabajo", "Número total de accidentes", "Tasa de accidentes relacionados con el trabajo (criterio CSRD, equivalente a la tasa de frecuencia de la Ley 11/2018)", "Número total de días de ausencia debido a accidentes", "Tasa de accidentes" y "Tasa de gravedad". En 2024, no hubo accidentes ocupacionales fatales ni enfermedades relacionadas con el trabajo (0 para Hombres, Mujeres y Total). Las enfermedades relacionadas con el trabajo sumaron 3 casos (1 Hombres, 2 Mujeres). El número total de accidentes fue de 950 (317 Hombres, 633 Mujeres). La tasa de accidentes relacionados con el trabajo fue de 1.64 (1.15 Hombres, 2.08 Mujeres). El total de días de ausencia por accidentes fue de 36,711 (12,617 Hombres, 24,094 Mujeres). La tasa de accidentes fue de 0.05 (0.03 Hombres, 0.06 Mujeres) y la tasa de gravedad fue de 0.06 (0.05 Hombres, 0.08 Mujeres). En 2023, tampoco hubo accidentes ocupacionales fatales ni enfermedades relacionadas con el trabajo (0 para Hombres, Mujeres y Total). Las enfermedades relacionadas con el trabajo sumaron 15 casos (3 Hombres, 12 Mujeres). El número total de accidentes fue de 399 (128 Hombres, 271 Mujeres). La tasa de accidentes relacionados con el trabajo fue de 0.74 (0.51 Hombres, 0.94 Mujeres). La tasa de accidentes fue de 0.03 (0.02 Hombres, 0.04 Mujeres) y la tasa de gravedad fue de 0.04 (0.03 Hombres, 0.06 Mujeres).
  • ### Resumen de la tabla: La tabla detalla las metodologías utilizadas por Banco Santander para calcular las emisiones financiadas en diferentes categorías de su portafolio, siguiendo el estándar de la Partnership for Carbon Accounting Financials (PCAF). 1. **Emisiones financiadas de corporativos y proyectos**: Se calculan utilizando la fórmula "Emisiones financiadas = Factor de atribución x Emisiones". El factor de atribución se determina como "Monto pendiente / Valor total de la empresa", considerando el total de capital y deuda de la empresa. Para financiamiento de proyectos, se utiliza la producción y un factor de emisión. 2. **Auto - préstamos**: Las emisiones financiadas se calculan como "Factor de atribución x emisiones del vehículo". El factor de atribución se define como "Monto pendiente / Valor del vehículo al origen". Las emisiones del vehículo se basan en datos específicos del vehículo y la distancia anual estimada. 3. **Hipotecas y bienes raíces comerciales**: Las emisiones financiadas se calculan como "Emisiones del edificio x LTV". El factor de atribución se basa en el monto pendiente del préstamo dividido por el valor total de la propiedad al origen. 4. **Agricultura**: Las emisiones financiadas se calculan utilizando la producción, área de producción o número de animales multiplicado por un factor de emisión. Para emisiones por cambio de uso de suelo (LUC), se evalúan las pérdidas de cobertura arbórea y el stock de carbono utilizando metodologías específicas. 5. **Bonos soberanos**: Las emisiones financiadas se calculan como "Exposición al bono soberano (USD) / PIB ajustado por PPP (USD internacional) x Emisiones soberanas (tCO2e)". Las fuentes de datos incluyen informes de sostenibilidad, bases de datos como PCAF, y herramientas específicas como el GHG Protocol y MapBiomas.
  • ### Resumen de la tabla "Risk management and compliance" del informe anual de Santander 2024: La tabla presenta datos sobre la proporción de activos cubiertos en términos de sostenibilidad ambiental para el año 2024, expresados como porcentaje del total de activos cubiertos en el denominador. Las categorías principales incluyen "Climate Change Mitigation (CCM)", "Climate Change Adaptation (CCA)" y el total combinado ("TOTAL (CCM + CCA)"). Además, se desglosan los sectores relevantes según la taxonomía ("Taxonomy-eligible") y los activos ambientalmente sostenibles ("Taxonomy-aligned"). 1. **"Local governments financing"**: 83.4% del total de activos cubiertos, sin contribuciones a sectores relevantes ni activos sostenibles. 2. **"Housing financing"**: 99.1% del total de activos cubiertos, sin contribuciones a sectores relevantes ni activos sostenibles. 3. **"Other local government financing"**: 81.0% del total de activos cubiertos, sin contribuciones a sectores relevantes ni activos sostenibles. 4. **"Collateral obtained by taking possession: residential and commercial immovable properties"**: 0.0% en todas las categorías. 5. **"Total GAR assets"**: 34.0% del total de activos cubiertos, con 3.0% ambientalmente sostenibles, 2.8% destinados al uso de ingresos, 0.7% transicionales y 0.1% habilitadores. La proporción de activos totales cubiertos es del 69.8%.

Le ratio de rémunération totale annuelle au sein de l'entreprise est de 367.1 pour l'année 2024. Ce ratio est calculé en divisant la rémunération annuelle de l'individu le mieux payé par la rémunération annuelle médiane des employés (en excluant le mieux payé). La rémunération totale annuelle pour les employés, y compris les salaires, les primes, les avantages et autres compensations, s'élève à 14,3 milliards d'euros pour l'année 2024.

La méthodologie utilisée pour calculer ce ratio inclut la rémunération fixe et variable. Les critères pris en compte sont le salaire de base annuel ainsi que la rémunération variable versée sur l'année. La rémunération variable est distribuée à 50% en actions et 50% en espèces, et peut être sujette à une réduction ou un recouvrement.

Il n'y a pas d'informations spécifiques disponibles sur l'évolution de ce ratio au fil des années dans les documents fournis, ni de comparaisons avec des normes sectorielles ou des benchmarks.

The total number of terminated employees was 0.9% lower than in 2023, the turnover rate remained stable compared to the previous year, with variations of -1 percentage point in South America and North America and +2 points in Europe. 53.9% of those laid off are women, in line with the distribution of our workforce. C. Turnover rate is calculated over average headcount of the period. Annual report 2024 193 Contents Business model Sustainability Corporate Economic and Risk management and strategy statement governance financial review and compliance 13.Average remuneration by management group, gender, and age bracketA 2024 Not Women Men OtherBdeclaredBTotalC Gender 41,822 65,625 - - 53,131 Senior executivesOther executivesOther employees Total Management group 524,748 129,847 36,834 - 53,131 <30 30-50 >50 Total Age bracket 23,329 53,353 88,044 - 53,131
  • All our businesses and subsidiaries have short-term variable remuneration schemes to reflect what we have accomplished and how, according to Group-wide quantitative and qualitative goals as well as individual and team goals, behaviour, leadership, sustainability, commitment, growth and risk management. These schemes promote meritocracy, recognize individual and team contributions, and promote employee growth and well-being. Aligned with sustainability goals, the variable compensation of executive directors also weighs compliance with our sustainability and climate goals38 . In 2024, we paid EUR 14.3 billion in employee wages and benefits39 . To comply with EU regulations on remuneration and manage risk correctly, we identified 1.246 employees subject to a deferred variable pay scheme because their decisions can have a material impact40 on Santander's results. Therefore, the majority of them All our businesses and subsidiaries have short-term variable remuneration schemes to reflect what we have accomplished and how, according to Group-wide quantitative and qualitative goals as well as individual and team goals, behaviour, leadership, sustainability, commitment, growth and risk management. These schemes promote meritocracy, recognize individual and team contributions, and promote employee growth and well-being. Aligned with sustainability goals, the variable compensation of executive directors also weighs compliance with our sustainability and climate goals38 . In 2024, we paid EUR 14.3 billion in employee wages and benefits39 . To comply with EU regulations on remuneration and manage risk correctly, we identified 1.246 employees subject to a deferred variable pay scheme because their decisions can have a material impact40 on Santander's results. Therefore, the majority of them
  • 2024 2023 Argentina 2 1 Brazil 5 4 Chile 1 1 Uruguay 1 2 Spain 3 3 Poland 3 3 Portugal 3 2 UK 4 5 Mexico 3 2 USA 6 9 NPS to measure customer satisfaction, audited by Stiga/Deloitte.   • Accident rateF 0.03 0.06 0.05 0.02 0.04 0.03 Severity rateG0.05 0.08 0.06 0.03 0.06 0.04 A. As in the rest of this chapter, we only include information about our employees. In accident ratios, Santander Bank Polska s.a. is not included. B. Reported globally since 2023, following local laws for occupational illnesses where they are regulated country-wide or for specific jobs, as soon as a medical examination confirms the cause as occupational. C. We report occupational injuries that can be documented in 2024, including accidents while commuting. We standardized criteria, processes and systems across our footprint to calculate leave on medical grounds in every market. Banco Santander only considers occupational accidents and illnesses that, following expert review, are recognized as work-related and reported to official bodies (e.g. in Brazil, through a comunicação de acidente de trabalho — CAT, or work-related accident notice — to the Instituto Nacional Accident rateF 0.03 0.06 0.05 0.02 0.04 0.03 Severity rateG0.05 0.08 0.06 0.03 0.06 0.04 A.   • sustainability reporting. →Task Force on Climate-Related Financial Disclosures (TCFD) . The TCFD, which we support since 2017, has developed a framework to help public companies and other organizations more effectively disclose climate-related risks and opportunities through their existing reporting processes. Linked to Advocacy Forums →Instituto Internacional de Finanzas (IIF) : Grupo Santander's Executive Chair is the current IIF Chair and has sat on its board since 2014. The bank participates in several sustainability-related working groups, including the Sustainable Finance Policy Expert Group and the Sustainable Finance Data, Disclosure and Classification Expert Group. →European Banking Federation (EBF) : Santander is a member of several working groups, such as the ESG risk group, which a Santander director chairs; the Sustainable Finance Steering Committee; and the Chief Sustainability Officers Roundtable. sustainability reporting. →Task Force on Climate-Related Financial Disclosures (TCFD) . The TCFD, which we support since 2017, has developed a framework to help public companies and other organizations more effectively disclose climate-related risks and opportunities through their existing reporting processes. Linked to Advocacy Forums →Instituto Internacional de Finanzas (IIF) : Grupo Santander's Executive Chair is the current IIF Chair and has sat on its board since 2014. The bank participates in several sustainability-related working groups, including the Sustainable Finance Policy Expert Group and the Sustainable Finance Data, Disclosure and Classification Expert Group. →European Banking Federation (EBF) : Santander is a member of several working groups, such as the ESG risk group, which a Santander director chairs; the Sustainable Finance Steering Committee; and the Chief Sustainability Officers Roundtable.
S1-173

Quel est le ratio de la rémunération annuelle totale de la personne la mieux payée par rapport à la rémunération totale annuelle médiane de tous les salariés (à l'exclusion de la personne la mieux rémunérée) au sein de l'entreprise ?

nan

Le ratio de la rémunération annuelle totale de la personne la mieux payée par rapport à la rémunération totale annuelle médiane de tous les salariés (à l'exclusion de la personne la mieux rémunérée) au sein de l'entreprise est de 367,1 pour l'année 2024.


Afficher les sourcesLLM
Sources LLM :
  • ### 14. Remuneration ratios The table presents remuneration ratios for the year 2024. It includes the following metrics: - **Hourly GPG ratio (average)**: 36%. - **GPG ratio (median)**: 26%, which accounts for annual base salary and variable remuneration paid in the year. - **EPG ratio**: Approximately 0. - **Remuneration ratio**: 367.1, calculated as the annual remuneration of the highest-paid individual divided by the median employee annual remuneration (excluding the highest-paid). and

    BEGIN TABLE

    0 1
    2024
    Hourly GPG ratio (average) 36%
    GPG ratio (median)A 26%
    EPG ratio c. 0
    Remuneration ratio 367.1
  • ### END TABLE A. GPG Ratio (median) includes annual base salary and variable remuneration paid in the year. B. Ratio of the annual remuneration of the highest-paid individual for the performance of executive duties (salary, pension contributions, variable remuneration); divided over Median employee annual remunerations (excluding the highest-paid). This figure is impacted by our business model, with a large presence in three geographical regions (Europe, North and South America) and a large network of branches (c.8,000), since more than half of our employees are based in Mexico and South America (mainly in Brazil) where remuneration is aligned to the local cost of living, much lower than that of other countries that are the reference for establishing the remuneration of executive directors. In addition, the use of the median overstates this effect versus the mean: with average data the result of the ratio would be 239.7. ### END TABLE A. GPG Ratio (median) includes annual base salary and variable remuneration paid in the year. B. Ratio of the annual remuneration of the highest-paid individual for the performance of executive duties (salary, pension contributions, variable remuneration); divided over Median employee annual remunerations (excluding the highest-paid). This figure is impacted by our business model, with a large presence in three geographical regions (Europe, North and South America) and a large network of branches (c.8,000), since more than half of our employees are based in Mexico and South America (mainly in Brazil) where remuneration is aligned to the local cost of living, much lower than that of other countries that are the reference for establishing the remuneration of executive directors. In addition, the use of the median overstates this effect versus the mean: with average data the result of the ratio would be 239.7.
  • variable compensation (ranging from 40% to 60%, depending on their level of responsibility) for a period of four to seven years. This variable compensation is paid out 50% in shares and 50% in cash, and is subject to a possible reduction (malus) or recovery (clawback). For more information on adequate salaries, total remuneration ratio, see SN 7.3 'Employees'. variable compensation (ranging from 40% to 60%, depending on their level of responsibility) for a period of four to seven years. This variable compensation is paid out 50% in shares and 50% in cash, and is subject to a possible reduction (malus) or recovery (clawback). For more information on adequate salaries, total remuneration ratio, see SN 7.3 'Employees'.
  • ### Equal pay Our remuneration practices promote a non-discriminatory salary management in terms of gender and equivalent remuneration, especially in those cases where employees perform the same or similar work (equally remunerated for equal work or work of equal value). Our salary comparison between women and men who perform similar functions remains at c. 0, which confirms our positive performance in recent years and meets the ambition we set for 202541. In certain jurisdictions we continue to periodically assess compensation levels for pay equity and where appropriate make adjustments to compensation. We often consult our employees to gauge how appropriate and acceptable our remuneration policies are and they recently deemed our remuneration policies competitive. For more information about the employee consultation process, refer to section 3.1.4. 'Our listening strategy'. ### Equal pay Our remuneration practices promote a non-discriminatory salary management in terms of gender and equivalent remuneration, especially in those cases where employees perform the same or similar work (equally remunerated for equal work or work of equal value). Our salary comparison between women and men who perform similar functions remains at c. 0, which confirms our positive performance in recent years and meets the ambition we set for 202541. In certain jurisdictions we continue to periodically assess compensation levels for pay equity and where appropriate make adjustments to compensation. We often consult our employees to gauge how appropriate and acceptable our remuneration policies are and they recently deemed our remuneration policies competitive. For more information about the employee consultation process, refer to section 3.1.4. 'Our listening strategy'.

Los pilares son: 1. **Targets**: Evalúa la calidad y ambición de los objetivos cuantitativos para reducir las emisiones de GEI. 2. **Action plan**: Examina la profundidad de la estrategia de alineación para alcanzar los objetivos de reducción de emisiones de GEI. 3. **Disclosure**: Analiza la transparencia en la presentación de informes sobre emisiones de GEI en los ámbitos relevantes. 4. **Governance**: Considera la supervisión y gobernanza de la estrategia de transición por parte de la gestión. ### END TABLE and

  • ### Resumen de la tabla "Risk management and compliance": La tabla presenta cinco áreas clave relacionadas con la gestión de riesgos y el cumplimiento: 1. **Inclusive Culture**: Avances en la cultura inclusiva y otras iniciativas como la accesibilidad. 2. **Financial inclusion**: Progresos en los objetivos de inclusión financiera y otras iniciativas clave en la agenda social, como la educación financiera y la inversión comunitaria. 3. **Sustainable finance**: Avances en las finanzas sostenibles y la inversión socialmente responsable. 4. **Climate**: Progresos en el plan de transición y los principales mecanismos para cumplir con la ambición de alcanzar emisiones netas cero. 5. **Governance and cross cutting matters**: Realización de la evaluación de doble materialidad, implementación de políticas de sostenibilidad y mejora de la eficiencia y calidad de los datos. and

    Inclusive Culture Progress with inclusive culture and other initiatives such as accessibility.

    Sustainable finance Progress with sustainable finance and socially responsible investment.
    Climate Progress with our transition plan and the key levers to fulfil our net zero ambition.
    Governance and cross cutting matters Conducting our double materiality assessment, implementing sustainability policies, and enhancing data efficiency and quality.

  • ### Resumen de la tabla "Risk management and compliance": La tabla presenta datos relacionados con el sector "Power generation" entre los años 2019 y 2023. Los indicadores incluyen "Exposure (drawn amount EUR bn)", "Absolute emissions (MtCO2e)", "Physical emissions intensity (MtCO2e/MWh)", "Financial emissions intensity (MtCO2e/ EUR bn lent)", "PCAF score" y el "2030 target". En 2019, la exposición fue de 10.66 EUR bn, las emisiones absolutas alcanzaron 5.41 MtCO2e, la intensidad de emisiones físicas fue de 0.21 MtCO2e/MWh, y la intensidad financiera fue de 0.51 MtCO2e/EUR bn, con un PCAF score de 2.7 y un objetivo para 2030 de 0.11 tCO2e/MWh. En 2020, la exposición disminuyó a 10.31 EUR bn, las emisiones absolutas bajaron a 4.59 MtCO2e, la intensidad física fue de 0.17 MtCO2e/MWh, y la intensidad financiera fue de 0.45 MtCO2e/EUR bn, con un PCAF score de 2.5. En 2021, la exposición fue de 10.23 EUR bn, las emisiones absolutas se redujeron a 4.24 MtCO2e, la intensidad física aumentó ligeramente a 0.19 MtCO2e/MWh, y la intensidad financiera fue de 0.41 MtCO2e/EUR bn, con un PCAF score de 2.8. En 2022, la exposición aumentó a 11.88 EUR bn, las emisiones absolutas bajaron a 3.82 MtCO2e, la intensidad física fue de 0.16 MtCO2e/MWh, y la intensidad financiera disminuyó a 0.32 MtCO2e/EUR bn, con un PCAF score de 3.0. En 2023, la exposición fue de 10.75 EUR bn, las emisiones absolutas se redujeron aún más a 3.14 MtCO2e, la intensidad física fue de 0.15 MtCO2e/MWh, y la intensidad financiera bajó a 0.29 MtCO2e/EUR bn, con un PCAF score de 3.2. and

    Risk management and compliance

    BEGIN TABLE

    0 1 2 3 4 5 6 7
    Sector Year Exposure (drawn amount EUR bn) Absolute emissions (MtCO2e) Physical emissions intensity (MtCO2e/MWh) Financial emissions intensity (MtCO2e/ EUR bn lent) PCAF score 2030 target
    Power generation 2019 10.66 5.41 0.21 0.51 2.7 0.11 tCO2e/ MWh
    2020 10.31 4.59 0.17 0.45 2.5
    2021 10.23 4.24 0.19 0.41 2.8
    2022 11.88 3.82 0.16 0.32 3.0
    2023 10.75 3.14 0.15 0.29 3.2

Le ratio de la rémunération annuelle totale de la personne la mieux payée par rapport à la rémunération totale annuelle médiane de tous les salariés (à l'exclusion de la personne la mieux rémunérée) au sein de l'entreprise est de 367,1.

  • ### Summary of the Table The table presents the "Average remuneration of senior management (with variable remuneration not linked to long-term objectives)" in "Thousand euros" for the years "2024" and "2023." It includes data for "Men," "Women," and "Total" across three categories: "Executive directors," "Non-executive directors," and "Senior management." - For "Executive directors," the remuneration in 2024 was "9,137" for men, "12,127" for women, and "10,632" in total, compared to "8,257" for men, "11,544" for women, and "9,900" in total in 2023. - For "Non-executive directors," the remuneration in 2024 was "285" for men, "356" for women, and "309" in total, compared to "368" for men, "327" for women, and "352" in total in 2023. - For "Senior management," the remuneration in 2024 was "3,898" for men, "1,380" for women, and "3,538" in total, compared to "4,112" for men, "1,645" for women, and "3,583" in total in 2023.
  • 39 See Note 46 of the annual accounts. 40 Material risk-takers. 41 Measured with the EPG - equal pay gap ratio, which compares the average compensation between men and women who perform similar tasks. Results for 2024, across the entire Group. 42 Average employee rating of the statement "I receive fair pay according to market rates (e.g. salary, promotions and benefits) for my contribution to Santander", putting us in the top 25% of the finance sector. 43 Average employee rating of the statement "the processes for determining compensation (e.g. salary, bonus and benefits) are fair and impartial", in line with sector benchmarks.
  • ### BEGIN TABLE La tabla presenta una visión general de los pilares de transición relacionados con la reducción de emisiones de gases de efecto invernadero (GEI). Los pilares son: 1. **Targets**: Evalúa la calidad y ambición de los objetivos cuantitativos para reducir las emisiones de GEI. 2. **Action plan**: Examina la profundidad de la estrategia de alineación para alcanzar los objetivos de reducción de emisiones de GEI. 3. **Disclosure**: Analiza la transparencia en la presentación de informes sobre emisiones de GEI en los ámbitos relevantes. 4. **Governance**: Considera la supervisión y gobernanza de la estrategia de transición por parte de la gestión. ### END TABLE
  • ### Resumen de la tabla "Risk management and compliance": La tabla presenta cinco áreas clave relacionadas con la gestión de riesgos y el cumplimiento: 1. **Inclusive Culture**: Avances en la cultura inclusiva y otras iniciativas como la accesibilidad. 2. **Financial inclusion**: Progresos en los objetivos de inclusión financiera y otras iniciativas clave en la agenda social, como la educación financiera y la inversión comunitaria. 3. **Sustainable finance**: Avances en las finanzas sostenibles y la inversión socialmente responsable. 4. **Climate**: Progresos en el plan de transición y los principales mecanismos para cumplir con la ambición de alcanzar emisiones netas cero. 5. **Governance and cross cutting matters**: Realización de la evaluación de doble materialidad, implementación de políticas de sostenibilidad y mejora de la eficiencia y calidad de los datos.
  • ### Resumen de la tabla: La tabla presenta datos relacionados con los activos ambientalmente sostenibles y el Green Asset Ratio (GAR) en el contexto del artículo 8 del Reglamento de Taxonomía para el año 2023. Los encabezados de las columnas son: "Total environmentally sustainable assets (1)", "KPI (3)", "KPI (4)", "% coverage (over total assets) (5)", "% of assets excluded from the numerator of the GAR (Article 7.2 and 7.3 and Section 1.1.2. of Annex V)", y "% of assets excluded from the denominator of the GAR (Article 7.1 and Section 1.2.4 of Annex V)". La fila de datos incluye los siguientes valores: "Green asset ratio (GAR) Main KPI stock 31,151" en la columna 0, "2.4" en la columna 1, "2.6" en la columna 2, "70.3" en la columna 3, "33.9" en la columna 4, y "29.7" en la columna 5.
  • ### Resumen de la tabla "Risk management and compliance": La tabla presenta datos relacionados con el sector "Power generation" entre los años 2019 y 2023. Los indicadores incluyen "Exposure (drawn amount EUR bn)", "Absolute emissions (MtCO2e)", "Physical emissions intensity (MtCO2e/MWh)", "Financial emissions intensity (MtCO2e/ EUR bn lent)", "PCAF score" y el "2030 target". En 2019, la exposición fue de 10.66 EUR bn, las emisiones absolutas alcanzaron 5.41 MtCO2e, la intensidad de emisiones físicas fue de 0.21 MtCO2e/MWh, y la intensidad financiera fue de 0.51 MtCO2e/EUR bn, con un PCAF score de 2.7 y un objetivo para 2030 de 0.11 tCO2e/MWh. En 2020, la exposición disminuyó a 10.31 EUR bn, las emisiones absolutas bajaron a 4.59 MtCO2e, la intensidad física fue de 0.17 MtCO2e/MWh, y la intensidad financiera fue de 0.45 MtCO2e/EUR bn, con un PCAF score de 2.5. En 2021, la exposición fue de 10.23 EUR bn, las emisiones absolutas se redujeron a 4.24 MtCO2e, la intensidad física aumentó ligeramente a 0.19 MtCO2e/MWh, y la intensidad financiera fue de 0.41 MtCO2e/EUR bn, con un PCAF score de 2.8. En 2022, la exposición aumentó a 11.88 EUR bn, las emisiones absolutas bajaron a 3.82 MtCO2e, la intensidad física fue de 0.16 MtCO2e/MWh, y la intensidad financiera disminuyó a 0.32 MtCO2e/EUR bn, con un PCAF score de 3.0. En 2023, la exposición fue de 10.75 EUR bn, las emisiones absolutas se redujeron aún más a 3.14 MtCO2e, la intensidad física fue de 0.15 MtCO2e/MWh, y la intensidad financiera bajó a 0.29 MtCO2e/EUR bn, con un PCAF score de 3.2.

Le ratio de la rémunération annuelle totale de la personne la mieux payée par rapport à la rémunération totale annuelle médiane de tous les salariés (à l'exclusion de la personne la mieux rémunérée) au sein de l'entreprise est de 367,1 pour l'année 2024.

GPG Ratio (median) includes annual base salary and variable remuneration paid in the year. B. Ratio of the annual remuneration of the highest-paid individual for the performance of executive duties (salary, pension contributions, variable remuneration); divided over Median employee annual remunerations (excluding the highest-paid). This figure is impacted by our business model, with a large presence in three geographical regions (Europe, North and South America) and a large network of branches (c.8,000), since more than half of our employees are based in Mexico and South America (mainly in Brazil) where remuneration is aligned to the local cost of living, much lower than that of other countries that are the reference for establishing the remuneration of executive directors. Groups with less than 50 employees (others, not declared) are not included because they are not statistically relevant and to avoid statistically erroneous conclusions. C. The average pay of our constant workforce (i.e. employees who were with us at 2023 year end and remained at 2024 year end) grew 11.4% in 2024 in constant euros (this does not include Argentina due to exchange rate distortions between the two periods).   • impact40 on Santander's results. Therefore, the majority of them are subject to a policy of deferral of a significant portion of theirvariable compensation (ranging from 40% to 60%, depending on their level of responsibility) for a period of four to seven years. This variable compensation is paid out 50% in shares and 50% in cash, and is subject to a possible reduction (malus) or recovery (clawback). For more information on adequate salaries, total remuneration ratio, see SN 7.3 'Employees'. Equal pay Our remuneration practices promote a non-discriminatory salary management in terms of gender and equivalent remuneration, especially in those cases where employees perform the same or similar work (equally remunerated for equal work or work of equal value). Our salary comparison between women and men who perform similar functions remains at c. 0, which confirms our positive performance in recent years and meets the ambition we set for impact40 on Santander's results.   • Accident rateF 0.03 0.06 0.05 0.02 0.04 0.03 Severity rateG0.05 0.08 0.06 0.03 0.06 0.04 A. As in the rest of this chapter, we only include information about our employees. In accident ratios, Santander Bank Polska s.a. is not included. B. Reported globally since 2023, following local laws for occupational illnesses where they are regulated country-wide or for specific jobs, as soon as a medical examination confirms the cause as occupational. C. We report occupational injuries that can be documented in 2024, including accidents while commuting. We standardized criteria, processes and systems across our footprint to calculate leave on medical grounds in every market. Banco Santander only considers occupational accidents and illnesses that, following expert review, are recognized as work-related and reported to official bodies (e.g. in Brazil, through a comunicação de acidente de trabalho — CAT, or work-related accident notice — to the Instituto Nacional Accident rateF 0.03 0.06 0.05 0.02 0.04 0.03 Severity rateG0.05 0.08 0.06 0.03 0.06 0.04 A.   • and wind energy projects in Spain and Portugal; and Santander Innoenergy Climate Fund, a venture capital strategy that invests in climate technology startups that work on renewable energy, smart grids, energy efficiency, storage systems, green energy batteries, mobility and the circular economy. SAM has an advisory mandate for LA Green, a blended finance fund to boost the SME green bond market in Latin America, mobilize large-scale capital and make a positive contribution to society and the environment. Moreover, SAM’s SRI products include solidarity funds that donate a portion of their fees to NGOs. In 2024, we boosted our proposition by making changes to two equity funds: Santander Sostenible Bonos and Santander Sostenible Renta Fija Ahorro, and two profiled funds: Santander Sostenible Crecimiento andSantander Sostenible Evolución a solidarios. These funds donated to several NGOs to educate young people at risk of exclusion and and wind energy projects in Spain and Portugal; and Santander Innoenergy Climate Fund, a venture capital strategy that invests in climate technology startups that work on renewable energy, smart grids, energy efficiency, storage systems, green energy batteries, mobility and the circular economy.   • analysis methods and models that complement our qualitative methodology and provide a forward-looking and geography-based analysis of portfolios across the medium and long term, considering impacts based on their probability, relevance and duration.
